item.title: McDonald's is Teaming Up With Sonic the Hedgehog
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • McDonald's, Sega, and Paramount collaborate for Sonic the Hedgehog 3 toys tied to the upcoming film release.
  • The Sonic the Hedgehog 3 film expands with new characters and may adapt elements from Sonic Adventure 2.
  • The toy line includes figures of Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, and Shadow.

The fast-food chain McDonald's is teaming up with Sega and Paramount with a new line of toys based on the upcoming Sonic the Hedgehog 3 film set to hit theaters later this month on December 20. While there is no information yet about when the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 toys might make their way to North American locations, it seems likely that they will, given previous tie-ins with the franchise.

Sonic the Hedgehog 3 is one of the most anticipated films of this year, as previous trailers and casting announcements, such as Keanu Reeves as Shadow, have drummed up significant hype among fans. The film continues to expand the franchise with new and returning characters, with many believing it will adapt various elements and plotlines from the fan-favorite game Sonic Adventure 2 .

Now, fans can get another look at the upcoming film in the form of a Colombian advertisement for a series of McDonald's toys depicting the film's main characters as part of an official collaboration. The short commercial shows the main characters of Sonic the Hedgehog 3 , Sonic, Tails, and Knuckles, alongside Shadow delivering Happy Meals before revealing multiple small figures based on the characters.

New Sonic 3 McDonald's Toys May Have Story Implications

The rest of this article contains POSSIBLE SPOILERS for the Sonic the Hedgehog 3 movie

The toy line depicts Sonic, Tails, Knuckles, and Shadow in multiple poses within a plastic ring, though it is unclear what their playable function might look like, so fans might have to pick up a Happy Meal to find out. In addition to the base versions of each main character, the toys also feature versions based on Super Sonic and Super Shadow, lending credence to the idea that the film may be adapting elements from Sonic Adventure 2.

Sega's iconic mascot has been on the rise this year, with fans largely praising the recent release of Sonic x Shadow Generations , an expanded remaster of one of Sonic's most acclaimed titles. While much of Sega's output of Sonic games has been met with inconsistent critical reception in the past, the ongoing film franchise's success has seemingly proven the series' lasting legacy in the public eye.

This is far from the only time McDonald's has crossed over with major gaming franchises in some form, either, as the fast food chain has previously offered toys and merchandise based on the Pokemon franchise. Just this year, it even collaborated with Konami and Sanrio to create a series of Hello Kitty toys based on various Yu-Gi-Oh characters.

item.title: New Steam Game Looks Like Sci-Fi Stardew Valley
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Ekoh Beach, a new sci-fi life sim, releases on Steam on April 4, 2025.
  • Players explore mines, forests, rebuild houses, and interact with 35 NPCs in Ekoh Beach.
  • Ekoh Beach has a cozy atmosphere like Stardew Valley, but with a sci-fi twist.

A new sci-fi life sim with strong Stardew Valley vibes called Ekoh Beach has been announced for Steam , and it seems like an excellent option for gamers who want some variety after playing the popular farming sim for years. Steam has seen no shortage of excellent life sims in the last few years, and this game is the latest one to promise fans of the genre a good time with a unique setting.

Ever since Stardew Valley was released and exploded in popularity in 2016, the life simulation genre has become increasingly popular. In recent years, gamers have seen excellent examples of games like Stardew Valley , going from more traditional ones like Fields of Mistria to others such as Mirthwood .

Now, Zenland Games has announced that Ekoh Beach will be released on Steam on April 4, 2025. The game will be set in Ekoh 99, a tropical town on a distant planet that was destroyed by a robot rebellion. Instead of taking care of a farm like in most games in the life simulation genre, Ekoh Beach puts the player in the shoes of the city planner, having to engage in several activities, such as exploring mines, forests, and beaches, gathering resources, harvesting materials, rebuilding houses, and more. During the game, players will have unique items such as the Z-Cleaner to scoop up mineral-rich particles to use in rebuilding the town. Also, Ekoh Beach features over 35 NPCs that the player can build relationships with as they get to know Ekoh 99.

When Will Ekoh Beach Be Released on Steam?

  • Ekoh Beach will be available on April 4, 2025.

Ekoh Beach ’s world will be filled with many secrets of its past, and gamers will be even able to run for mayor, convincing the villagers that they are doing good work rebuilding the city. Overall, Ekoh Beach seems to be a title with a very cozy atmosphere and style that greatly resembles Stardew Valley , and it looks like the perfect pick for gamers who love life simulation games

Ekoh Beach is not the only recent game to look like a sci-fi version of Stardew Valley , though. Earlier this year, Farlands was released on Steam. The title also incorporated the classic pixelated style of Stardew Valley into its aesthetic, and like Ekoh Beach , it was set on an alien planet. However, the recent game seemed to have a bigger emphasis on farming and also allowed the player to create their own spaceship, which could be customized in several different ways.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Reveals Ifa's Rarity
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Ifa, leaked to be a 4-Star character, will debut from Tlalocan, filling the gap in male character representation.
  • Male characters in Genshin Impact are often hypercarries, leading to gameplay variety issues.
  • Ifa's release suggests 2025 may see a similar trend of limited male character options like 2024.

A reliable source in the Genshin Impact community has revealed that Ifa will be a 4-Star character from Tlalocan, set to make his playable debut in a future update. While Genshin Impact has introduced major quality-of-life changes in Natlan, its treatment of male characters in 2024 left a lot to be desired. Kinich remains the sole 5-Star male character released in 2024, and given that Natlan isn't expected to release any additional male characters after Ifa, it's safe to assume that 2025 is going to be more of the same.

From a gameplay standpoint, male characters in Genshin Impact tend to be hypercarries rather than support units. While Ororon was recently released in Version 5.2 as a 4-Star Electro Support, players need to go all the way back to Version 3.6 to find another example in Baizhu – who is a 5-Star Dendro Support. This lack of variety in gameplay, as well as a general lack of 5-Star male characters, has caused some resentment in the Genshin Impact community.

With Kinich and Ororon being the only male characters released in Natlan thus far, many Genshin Impact players were hoping that Ifa would salvage the situation. However, as revealed by Full Stop Chan via hxg_diluc, Ifa will be a 4-Star character from the Flower-Feather Clan. His weapon type and element are currently unknown, but as a Saurian veterinarian, it's likely that he will play the role of a Support. Ifa was indirectly confirmed as playable thanks to the upcoming weekly boss in Genshin Impact , as Xiuhcoatl's voice lines contain unique lines for both Ifa and Varesa.

Genshin Impact: Upcoming Characters

  • Mavuika
  • Citlali
  • Lan Yan
  • Ayano
  • Iansan
  • Ifa
  • Varesa

With Ayano expected to release in Version 5.4 as a new Genshin Impact character from Inazuma, there are a few scenarios to consider for the other three units. Iansan and Varesa are both from the Collective of Plenty, but unlike Ifa, their rarities remain unconfirmed. While the most common assumption places Iansan as a 5-Star character, Ororon and Citlali have proven that being one of the six Heroes of Natlan does not guarantee one's rarity.

That being said, if the Collective of Plenty zone is released in Version 5.5, it means that Genshin Impact will have to debut either Iansan or Varesa for the new exploration ability. With Ifa being a 4-Star character in Genshin Impact , it's highly likely that he will launch alongside whoever ends up being the featured 5-Star of Version 5.5. Players will find out more in the coming months, as Version 5.5 is set to be released on March 26, 2025.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Season 14 is Crossing Over With Avatar: The Last Airbender
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Overwatch 2 Season 14 introduces new Tank hero Hazard, Norse mythology skins, and Avatar: The Last Airbender crossover.
  • Fans can enjoy Winter Wonderland 2024 and Lunar New Year events, plus 6v6 Role Queue Experiment.
  • New season brings back Overwatch Classic mode and features Moth Meta era.

Blizzard has confirmed that Overwatch 2 is crossing over with Avatar: The Last Airbender as part of the game's Season 14 content. Overwatch 2 Season 14 is set to go live on December 10, with its headlining new addition being none other than the game's new Tank hero, Hazard.

Overwatch 2 gave fans the chance to try Hazard on a trial basis recently, letting them try out the new hero's abilities and see how he pairs with other characters on the roster. While fans have been mixed on Hazard's design, many seem to have enjoyed his ability kit. Hazard will be introduced to Overwatch 2 proper on December 10 when Season 14 starts, but he's just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the hero shooter's new season.

Blizzard has revealed a new trailer for Overwatch 2 that shows off what the studio has planned for Season 14. Besides Hazard, who is bringing a makeover to the Oasis map's spawn rooms, Overwatch 2 Season 14 will also feature a Mythic Thor Reinhardt Skin and a new Premium Battle Pass that includes an Odin Sigma skin, Celestial Mei skin, and Hazard's Mobster skin. Other Norse mythology skins will also be available, plus there will be fresh skins to purchase in the shop as well. The end of the trailer teased a crossover with Avatar: The Last Airbender , and since a Venture skin was previously promised for Season 14, speculation is that the character will be represented as part of the collab, though that has yet to be confirmed.

Overwatch 2 Season 14 Trailer

Overwatch 2 Season 14 will feature multiple events for players to enjoy. When Season 14 starts on December 10, fans will get to check out Winter Wonderland 2024, which will see the return of Mei's Snowball Offensive and Freezethaw Elimination. The Lunar New Year event will also be a part of Season 14, with this iteration being Year of the Snake.

Perhaps the most exciting limited-time mode coming to Overwatch 2 as part of Season 14 is its 6v6 Role Queue Experiment. Overwatch 2 is bringing back 6v6 on an experimental basis from December 17 to January 6, with a different 6v6 experiment scheduled for later in the season. Considering how much the community has been championing for the return of 6v6, it will be interesting to see how they react when it's actually implemented in the game.

On top of all this, Overwatch 2 fans can also look forward to a new take on the Overwatch Classic game mode, with this iteration bringing the game back to its Moth Meta era. Overwatch 2 fans can look forward to all of this and more as part of Season 14.

item.title: Best Cooperative Games Perfect For Date Nights
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Escape Room Simulator allows long-distance friends and family to experience the thrill of escape rooms together, with challenging but not frustrating puzzles.
  • Borderlands 2 offers a cooperative gaming experience with a well-developed story, fleshed-out characters, and plenty of quests to enjoy.
  • Phasmophobia provides a terrifying cooperative gaming experience for horror fans, perfect for casual gaming date nights.

The video game industry has always been a great way for friends and family members to spend some valuable time together - even more so since the invention of online gaming, which has allowed people living apart to continue to have fun together. Thankfully, there are hundreds of amazing co-op games that people can play with their friends and partners.

A few of these games are great for building relationships, and they make for amazing long-distance date-night ideas. They're fun, they're exciting, and a lot of them have a great storyline to follow. Without further ado, here are the best cooperative games for two players to enjoy .

Updated December 4, 2024, by Mara Cowley: Online games have become one of the most popular ways to enjoy the medium, as they can be played with friends or partners without making them leave the comfort of their own sofa or desk. Modern couples can now even make a date out of it by enjoying a two-player cooperative game, instead of meeting up to watch a movie or for dinner. This list already contained a multitude of titles across many genres, so there was already something for everyone, but there are still many more titles that may be overlooked by gamer couples. As such, this article has been updated to feature even more of the best co-op games for couples .

33 Moon Hunters

A Fantasy Roguelike With Hours Of Fun

  • Platforms: PC, Nintendo Switch, PS4, Xbox One
  • Release Date: March 10th, 2016
  • Developers: Kitfox Games
  • Genre: Roguelite, Fantasy

In the fantasy world of Issaria, the moon does not rise one night. As the source of power in the world, the balance of the world is affected, and it is up to the heroes to set it right. They will battle through monsters, explore the lands, and make choices that can help determine the ending.

The procedurally-generated world ensures that no two playthroughs feel the same, and roping a partner in only makes the game more fun. For couples looking for a drop-in drop-out game with some substance, they can't go wrong with Moon Hunters .

32 Until Dawn

An Interactive Horror Movie

The Dark Pictures Anthology implemented a game mode known as 'Movie Mod,' in which players would pass a controller back and forth after each chapter so that two players in the same place could play the game together. Though this is not an official implementation in Until Dawn , players can still make the mode work by passing over the controller at the start of each chapter.

This way, two partners have sway over the outcome of the game. They can either work together to gain their desired outcome by carefully selecting choices or let the chips fall where they may and see what kind of ending it leads to.

31 Monster Prom

A Multiplayer Dating Sim

Dating sims are normally a single-player affair, placing an emphasis on characters and story that doesn't really leave much room for a multiplayer implementation. But the developers at Beautiful Glitch showed everyone how it was meant to be done with Monster Prom .

In this game, players choose one of four monsters who are scrambling to find their perfect date for prom from one of the eligible characters available. They must choose their actions and words carefully, or they will be left to attend prom alone. Players have the option to help or hinder their partner and their romantic endeavors, adding a layer of hilarity and chaos to this clearly hilariously chaotic game.

30 A Way Out

Players Must Coordinate Their Efforts

For couples that are not looking for a cozy/cutesy game but something that packs more of a punch, A Way Out is the perfect title. Two prisoners, Leo and Vincent, are attempting a jailbreak and to escape the authorities so they can enjoy their freedom. But breaking out of prison is no small feat, so teamwork is essential to ensure their plans come to fruition.

What makes A Way Out special is that the game is specifically designed for two players — there is no single player option. The only way to play is local or online split screen, so even if the gamers are far apart, they will share a screen. There are plenty of times players will need to coordinate their efforts, such as one player distracting an NPC while the other grabs a set of keys, which makes it perfect for couples to flex just how harmonious their relationship is.

29 Diablo 4

Face Down The Legendary Lilith Together

Diablo returned bigger and better than before, with the stakes raised even higher from Diablo 3 . The prophecy speaks of Lilith's return, and thus, the Wanderer(s), aided by a few more companions, will suit and boot up to ensure her return is a short one.

Five classes return (Barbarian, Druid, Sorcerer, Rogue, and Necromancer), with the brand-new Spiritborn making its debut, to ensure both partners will find a class suiting their tastes and playstyle. Exciting combat and a thrilling story will ensure that couples have a game they can keep returning to for every date night.

28 Minecraft

Rewind With An Oldie But Goldie

There is likely not a gamer alive by now who hasn't tried their hand at the blocky sandbox survival game that is Minecraft , a title that allows gamers to relax, unwind, and get lost. It opens the doors for all manners of play, from cultivating a farm, to building entire towns, to delving deep into the dungeons.

As such, there is something for everyone to enjoy in Minecraft , and it is even more fun when playing it with a special someone. The two players can team up to create structures, slay enemies, or forage for materials they need to craft whatever their heart desires. There are hours of fun to be had, and countless gaming dates that can be spent here. And with its low requirements, and the classic Minecraft available for free, there is no excuse not to try this title out for date night.

27 Castle Crashers

A Fast-Paced Hack And Slash Adventure

Gamers are likely used to 2D platformers that require them to save a Princess thanks to the Mario game series, but Castle Crashers offers its own refreshing take on this tired trope. Now, players are armed with weapons to hack and slash through their enemies, and since it's too dangerous to go alone, they can even take someone with them.

The fun is only doubled with another player on the screen who is also trying to hack their way to victory through the hordes of enemies and big boss monsters, making it an ideal game for couples to enjoy together.

26 Left 4 Dead

Blast Through Hordes Of Undead While Working Together

For couples who love high-octane action and frantic gun gameplay, Left 4 Dead is the ideal game for them. They will assume the role of one of the four survivors who are attempting to escape the zombie-ridden city to safety, but there is an army's worth of undead between them and their escape route.

Large crowds of zombies and special infected make this game more fun than a standard run-of-the-mill zombie game, which is sure to make for a fun date night. What's more, there is Steam workshop support, so players can customize their game for even more unique fun.

25 Divinity: Original Sin 2

Dive Into An Original Fantasy World With A Loved One

Before Baldur's Gate 3 , Larian was known for Divinity , an RPG series with a unique world bursting with interesting lore, monsters, and NPCs. Original Sin 2 is a marked improvement on the original with improved graphics and a story that is sure to suck the players in and keep them gripped right until the unpredictable finale.

Though the party will normally consist of four, there is nothing stopping a couple from taking two NPCs with them or braving the world and its dangers with just the two of them. Whatever way they choose, the couple is sure to have fun, but the twist finale may just start a lovers' spat.

24 Baldur's Gate 3

Bring Swords And Sorcery To The Date Night With This RPG Epic

Even months after its release, Baldur's Gate 3 is still a hot topic among gamers, especially following the addition of Honour Mode. It follows the story of a number of people infected by Mind Flayer tadpoles who set out on a quest to find a way to cleanse themselves of that infection.

As with past Larian Studios RPGs, players can play with up to three more players and embark on a quest of epic proportions together. It is the perfect game for fantasy-loving couples to enjoy together, and it can definitely occupy couples for much more than just one night.

23 Dead By Daylight

Work Together To Escape The Horror Trials Alive

This multiplayer horror game has withstood the test of time even as other titles in the genre crumbled, which is a testament to its devoted fanbase. Thanks to securing licenses to famous franchises such as Halloween , Scream , and Resident Evil , Dead by Daylight has garnered horror fans far and wide to come together to take the roles of either survivors or killers.

Couples could easily queue up together as survivors and enjoy the thrilling and tense gameplay of DBD as they do their best to evade pursuing killers. Team play for this game is a must, making it the perfect game to experience with someone players share a strong bond with.

22 The Dark Pictures Anthology

An Interactive Horror Movie Experience That Couples Can Influence

The Dark Pictures Anthology is a collection of horror games made by Supermassive Games that follow the same format as their flagship game Until Dawn . The entire first season of The Dark Pictures is now released, so couples can experience all four games without waiting for the next to arrive.

Cooperatively, players will control different characters through each scene, and each can make choices to influence the direction of the game, allowing couples to craft the story as both of them wish. If couples should ever meet up in real life, they can enjoy Movie Night mode, in which two players share one controller and take turns playing the game.

21 BattleBlock Theater

A Fun And Action-Packed Platformer

  • Platforms: Xbox 360, PC
  • Release Date: April 3rd, 2013
  • Developers: The Behemoth, Big Timber Studio
  • Genre: Platform

All the world's a stage, and this is no more true than with the exhilarating platformer BattleBlock Theater . In this game, players must team up together and take on the mischievous technical felines in order to rescue Hatty Hattington.

The full story mode allows two players to work together on their rescue mission, making it the perfect drop in and out game for couples to enjoy. This game is bound to make couples laugh together and create some memories that won't soon be forgotten.

20 Escape Simulator

Challenging And Fun Puzzles To Solve Together

Everybody knows escape rooms, those fun-day activities where family or friends put their heads together and try to solve a series of puzzles in order to escape from a room that follows themes such as Ancient Egypt, murder mystery, sci-fi, and many more. For people who don't live in the same city, they can still experience this thrill with Escape Simulator .

Players craft an avatar with a limited but fun selection of character customization options and then load into the themed rooms in which they must discover clues, solve puzzles, and escape. The puzzles are challenging enough that players won't breeze through but not too difficult that it would lead to a quarrel.

19 Borderlands 2

A Fun And Fast Paced Shooter Game

Often hailed as the best entry in the Borderlands series, Borderlands 2 is a fun run-and-gun shooter that sees players take control of one of four Vault Hunters, those who scour the fictional world of Pandora in search of Vaults that are rumored to hold great treasures.

For gaming couples who want to experience a cooperative game with more substance, Borderlands 2 is the perfect game for them. It has a good story, fleshed-out characters, a main plot, and side quests for them to dive into and enjoy.

18 Phasmophobia

A Terrifying Ghost Hunting Game Perfect For Horror Fans

Horror fans haven't been forgotten about, and there are many cooperative games that will scare the holy living heck out of them. Phasmophobia is one such game, which revolves around a cast of blank characters who work as ghost hunters. They must infiltrate a chosen map, house, farmhouse, school, prison, and others with their ghost-hunting equipment to determine what sort of entity haunts the premise, but they should take care not to become its next victim.

This game is easy to drop in and drop out of for one or a few rounds, with no complex story or character arcs to follow, making it perfect for a casual gaming date night. And night certainly is the best time to play this terrifying cooperative game.

17 Don't Starve Together

Players Must Work Together To Survive The Hunger Pangs

Most players are probably familiar with Don't Starve , a survival game with a unique Tim Burton-esque art style that sees gamers struggling to survive out in the wilderness. They must craft, farm, and fight in order to stay alive for one more day.

Don't Starve Together is much the same, only with the addition of cooperative play. Players can team up with their loved ones to pull them into this strange and cruel world, and both of them must work together so they don't starve. It sounds simple enough, but this game will definitely provide a challenge.

16 Cuphead

For Couples Seeking An Aesthetically Pleasing Challenge

For couples who are looking for a game that packs more of a wallop, they should look no further than Cuphead . This tough run-and-gun platformer is done in the style of vintage cartoons with a charming, toon-like soundtrack to accompany it. The infamous difficulty of this game simmers beneath the innocent surface, ensnaring players into repeating tough bosses time and time again.

With a co-op mode, players can share their misery with their loved ones and experience the punishing gameplay together. But nothing is sweeter than the victory that comes from overcoming one of the game's many challenges.

15 Lovers In A Dangerous Spacetime

Requires Precise Team Work, Making It Perfect For Couples

Lovers In A Dangerous Spacetime is a space-based shooter game. The forces of Anti-Love are threatening the known universe. To combat this, the player and up to three friends must work together to collectively navigate their psychedelic neon spaceship through the galaxy, encountering threats along the way. Each level layout is randomized, so players will explore new areas each time they play.

Lovers In A Dangerous Spacetime is perfect for couples, not just because of the name. The player and their partner must communicate to navigate the shared controls of their ship. Each player must perform equally important duties, like controlling the turrets or the ship’s shields or being in charge of the GPS systems. It can be easy to simply relinquish the controls to the other player, but in this game, that can get quite hectic. This game offers players a great way to develop teamwork and communication skills.

14 Heave Ho

Chaotic And Fun Co-Op Gameplay

Heave Ho is a platform-party game designed for up to four players. The sole aim of the game is to reach the end goal and for players to simply not fall to their deaths. Players can only control their own two arms as they grapple across great chasms and fling themselves into the great beyond.

Playing Heave Ho with a partner can be pure chaos. Players can grip onto each other, putting their full faith and trust in one another. Of course, this can lead to complete trolling and total carnage in what can be described as the ultimate Lion King /Mufasa betrayal. If they’re feeling brave, players can attempt to coordinate their momentum to try and swing their wobbling combined rope-like limbs across the map. Luckily, the respawn time is almost instantaneous.
